title: grazing_(danmaku)
body:
"Grazing":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Graze is a scoring mechanic made notable in danmaku games such as Touhou Project. Grazing occurs when a bullet goes through the player character, but not through their hitbox (a circle in the middle of the player character's sprite, which is most often not visible.)

For livestock feeding in a field, see [[grazing_(livestock)]].

h4. See also:

* [[Danmaku]]
* [[Hitbox]]

title: rebirth_yamato
body:
[b]Space Battleship Yamato: Resurrection[/b], known in Japan as [b]Rebirth Yamato[/b] (宇宙戦艦ヤマト 復活篇, [i]Uchū Senkan Yamato: Fukkatsu Hen[/i]) is a 2009 Japanese animated [[science fiction]] action film, and the first part of a planned series of films which were to be the latest addition to the [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato]] saga. 

Resurrection is set in the year 2220, 21 years after the first Yamato story and 17 years after the story of the last animated film, [[Final Yamato]]. A wandering black hole is approaching the Solar System, and will surely destroy all life on Earth. The decision has been made to evacuate Earth's entire population. Thus a brand new younger crew and a new [[yamato_(uchuu_senkan_yamato)|Yamato]] are commissioned to help with the evacuation.

While planned as the first of a series of films, no others would be forthcoming. After the success of the live action film a year after the release of Resurrection, production began on [[uchuu_senkan_yamato_2199|a new reboot series, based on the original 1974 series]] instead of further sequel films.

h4.New characters

* [[Kodai Miyuki]]
* [[Orihara Maho]]
other_names: 宇宙戦艦ヤマト復活篇

title: sonozaki_shion
body:
A character in [[Higurashi no Naku Koro ni]]. She is voiced by [[Yukino Satsuki]].

The identical [[twins|twin]] [[sisters|sister]] of [[Sonozaki Mion]] as well as daughter of [[Sonozaki Akane]] and the granddaughter of [[Sonozaki Oryou]], who serves as the head of the Sonozaki family. She attends St. Lucia Academy and works as a [[waitress]] at [[Angel Mort]].

She has [[green eyes]], [[large breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[green hair]] stylized in a [[half updo]] with a [[yellow ribbon|yellow]] [[hair ribbon]] and [[parted bangs]]. 

Her school attire consists of a [[St. Lucia Academy School Uniform]] with a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[blue bow|blue]] [[striped bow]], and a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]].

Her casual attire consists of a [[ribbed sweater|ribbed]] [[white sweater|white]] [[turtleneck sweater]] and a [[black skirt]].

She has [[green eyes]], [[large breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[green hair]] stylized with [[parted bangs]] and a [[high ponytail]].

Her school attire consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[open vest|open]] [[yellow vest]], [[red necktie]], and a [[long skirt|long]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[red skirt]].

Her casual attire consists of a [[yellow shirt]], a [[white sweater]] [[sweater_around_waist|around her waist]], and [[blue pants]].

title: what_i_watched_what_i_expected_what_i_got_(meme)
body:
A [[4Chan]] [[meme]] featuring a series of three seemingly unrelated images that typically mirror a viewer's sentiment over a television program. Presumably, the person who created such an image is a viewer.

* "What I Watched": the program watched
* "What I Expected": expectations about the program, especially comparisons to another program
* "What I Got": what the viewer saw in the program that either confirmed or negated the expectations the viewer had.

title: darkon
body:
[b]Darkon[/b] is a character that is part of the [[artix_entertainment|Artix Entertainment]] universe. He is the main character of the [b]Elegy of Madness[/b] saga in [[adventurequest_worlds|AdventureQuest Worlds]].
Darkon was once sacrificed by his brother [b]Drago[/b]. He was sacrificed by the name of an entity called [b]the Fool[/b], and because of that, the Fool makes a deal with Darkon, where he is revived alongside [[re_(adventurequest_worlds)|Re]], [[la_(adventurequest_worlds)|La]] and Ti, but at the cost of it becoming it's eye and it's body. Later So, Mi and [[fa_(adventurequest_worlds)|Fa]] joins their group.

title: mate
body: Drink native to Latin America, particularly Argentina, Uruguay, and Paraguay. It is made by soaking dried leaves of the holly species, yerba mate ([i]Ilex paraguariensis[/i]), in hot water and is served with a metal straw in a container typically made from a calabash gourd (the mate proper), but also in some areas made from a cattle horn (guampa).

title: wu_zetian_(fate)
body:
Assassin-class Servant first seen in the Agartha chapter of [[Fate/Grand Order]]. The concubine of Emperor Taizong, but after his death, she married his son Gaozong and became Empress following a debilitating stroke that Gaozong suffered. She implemented the short-lived Zhou Dynasty in 690, interrupting the Tang Dynasty until it was abolished in 705 after her death.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Harada Takehito]]

title: loft_bed
body: A loft bed is a type of elevated [[bed]] that is raised high enough to allow the use of the floor area below it for various purposes, such as a work area or storage.  Essentially a [[bunk bed]] without the lower bed.

title: loft_(architecture)
body:
A partial floor at roof level.

For complete floors at roof level, see the [[attic]] tag.  For partial floors not at roof level, see the [[mezzanine]] tag.

title: attic
body:
A room or a space immediately below the roof of a building.  Functionally serves the purpose of controlling the house's temperature by providing a large mass of slowly moving air.  Normally difficult to access, hot due to trapping the hot air rising from other floors, and hard to clean because of their irregular shapes, they're traditionally used for storage and considered undesirable residential spaces.

The term attic refers to a complete floor below the roof of a building.  For partial floors use the [[loft_(architecture)|]] tag.

title: fae_(artix)
body:
[b]Fae[/b] is a character that is part of the [[artix_entertainment|Artix Entertainment]] universe. She is a character in [[dragonfable|DragonFable]], her major role being during the Earth Orb Saga. She has first appeared on the beta version of it. She also exists in [[adventurequest_worlds|AdventureQuest Worlds]]. 
When she was a kid, she found the Earth Orb on the ground and carried it with her. While carrying it, she was struck by a shadow aura, once it hit her, she sneezed, which turned her into a bird unwillingly. After turning back to "human", she found herself with cat-like features. Since then, everytime she sneezed she'd shapeshift into an animal.

[spoiler]It's later revealed that she has been in possession of the orb for over 1000 years.[/spoiler]

title: panapp
body:
A female character from [[choujikuu_yousai_macross|The Super Dimension Fortress Macross]] science fiction and [[mecha]] TV anime series from 1982. 

[b]Panapp[/b] (パナップ [i]Panapu[/i]) is a [[U.N. Spacy]] female officer who is part of the team that controls the [[Pin-Point Barrier System]] on the [[SDF-1]] Macross. She also works as a substitute bridge operator during the series.
 
She is named after a brand of popular Japanese [[ice cream]], also called "panapp". Since 1978 Glico company has produced this type of multi-layered ice cream cup. Due to time constraints many members of the original [[MACROSS]] production staff used to consume lots of this type of junk food, snacks and other treats during the long periods of work needed to complete the anime.

title: dragonfable
body:
Dragonfable is an RPG game created by [[artix_entertainment|Artix Entertainment]] in 2006 and is still updated on a weekly basis. 

The main storyline revolves around the player (knows as Hero) training as a dragonlord. The plot can be divided in three parts, which are called books: [b]Orb Saga, Elemental Dissonance and The End of Magic.[/b]
[b]The first book[/b] revolves around an enemy called Sepulchure which is after the Elemental Orbs, in order to get unlimited power.
[b]The second book[/b] is about The Hero helping another race against a mighty creature called "Wargoth".
[b]The third book[/b], still ongoing, takes place years later; The Herohas been frozen all this time and finally wakes up, only to find himself in an ambient controlled by an organization called "The rose", which happens to be an anti-magic movement.

h4. Characters

* [[fae_(artix)|Fae]]
* [[lady_celestia|Lady Celestia]]
* [[warlic|Warlic]]

title: bastet_(mythology)
body: In [[Egyptian mythology]], [b]Bastet[/b] is a [[cat]]-headed (or [[lion]]-headed) goddess of protection and childbirth who was worshipped at least since the Second Dynasty. Her name is also spelled Bast, Baast, Ubasti and Baset.

title: anubis_(stand)
body:
A [[stand (jojo)|Stand]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Sealed inside of a sword. Most associated with [[chaka (jojo)|Chaka]] and [[khan (jojo)|Khan]]. Its original owner died 500 years ago.

When someone wields the sword they are possessed by Anubis, forced to do its bidding as long as they hold it. Can phase through objects when swung, cutting objects behind an obstruction without hitting the obstruction itself. Possesses the ability to "learn" an opponent's attack, allowing it to counter without fail. The longer a fight lasts, the more attacks it becomes immune to.

Namesake is the ancient Egyptian god [[Anubis (mythology)|]].

title: mejiro_family_doctor
body:
[tn]"Attending Physician (Umamusume)", "Mejiro Family Doctor"[/tn]

Minor unnamed supporting character from the [[Umamusume]] anime. Personal doctor of the Mejiro household. 

The good doctor appears as a middle-aged man with [[short hair|short]] [[black hair|black]] hair and a constant no-nonsense, grim expression. He is drawn with noticeable East Asian facial features, contrasting with the rest of the cast's "mukokuseki" (anime "non-ethnic") artstyle.

The doctor wears a white tunic resembling a "Howie-style" labcoat with a [[mandarin collar]] and side buttons, but with [[short sleeves]] instead of long.

h5. Associated characters

* [[Tokai Teio (umamusume)|]]
* [[Mejiro McQueen (umamusume)|]]

h4. External links
* "The good doctor makes his appearance":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2IFl1YYSynY].

title: mimura_kanako
body:
An [i][[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character in the Cute (Pink Flower) category. 

On the short side and having a plump, full-figured body (by anime standards). She even loses weight after training, with her measurements going from 90-65-89 to 90-63-89. Loves making cookies and snacks. She is soft-spoken and kind with motherly warmth. She worries about her weight. 

Regularly nicknamed "grandma" by some in due to her personality. 

Due to her popularity, she was selected for the first CINDERELLA MASTER CD series, alongside [[Futaba Anzu]], [[Shibuya Rin]], [[Takagaki Kaede]] and [[Jougasaki Rika]]. Her seiyuu is [[Ootsubo Yuka]].

She is in the unit "CANDY ISLAND" with [[Futaba Anzu]] and [[Ogata Chieri]].

title: triangular_headpiece
body:
A type of headband sometimes worn by [[ghost]]s in Japanese folklore.

Derived from Edo period burial rituals, it was originally intended to protect the newly deceased from evil spirits. It has various regional names, [i]Hitai-eboshi[/i], [i]Tenkan[/i], [i]Houkan[/i], [i]Kami-kaburi[/i], and so on.

title: valkyrie_(fate)
body:
Umbrella tag for the three Lancer-class Servants in [[Fate/Grand Order]] who use [i]Valkyrie[/i] as their collective title. The three characters are seen through the Ascension function, and are ordered as follows:

* [[ortlinde (fate)|Ortlinde]] (black hair)
* [[hildr (fate)|Hildr]] (pink hair)
* [[thrud (fate)|Thrud]] (blonde hair; stylized as Thrúd)

There are six other miscellaneous Valkyries seen in their Noble Phantasm, where they all attack together. It is not until Valkyrie’s Swimsuit Assassin variant was introduced in summer 2022 that three more of them were named:

* [[Geirskogul (fate)|]] (brown hair)
* [[Olrun (fate)|]] (green hair, twintails)
* [[Rindr (fate)|]] (blonde hair done in a braided bun)

This leaves three remaining Valkyries that are still unnamed - a blue-haired one wearing a hood like Ortlinde's, a second black-haired one, and a purple-haired one.

title: aurora_e._juutilainen
body:
Character from [[Strike Witches: Aurora no Majo]].

[[eila ilmatar juutilainen|Eila]]'s older sister, she's a Captain working for the [[502nd Joint Fighter Wing]]'s Support Unit, which is tasked with retrieving their lost Striker units. She received the name "Terror Of Morocco" for her accomplishments in Hispania with the Gallian Foreing Legion, and she was later elevated to a Suomi national hero for her defense of her motherland as Commanding Officer of the 12th Division's 34th Infantry Regiment's 6th Company.

Her weapons include: a Lahti-L39 anti-tank rifle, a Suomi KP/31 sub-machine gun, a 75mm Witch Combat Cannon, and 3 Suomi satchel charges tacked together. Her familiar is the wolf, and she's based on Aarne Edward Juutilainen.
other_names: アウロラ・E・ユーティライネン

title: hanna_wind
body:
Character from [[Strike Witches: Aurora no Majo]].

Originally a Flying Officer serving in the [[Suomus Air Force 24th Squadron]], she was promoted to Flight Lieutenant in 1944 and transfered to the [[507th Joint Fighter Wing]]. She has the second highest score in Suomus. Her full name is Hanna Hertta Wind, and she's usually called Hasse by her friends. She's good friends with [[Nikka Edvardine Katajainen]], who resembles her, but beats her in chest size. 

Her weapons are an MG42 machine gun and a Lahti L-39 anti-tank rifle. Her familiar is the Eurasian eagle-owl, and she's based on Hans Wind.

title: qilin_(mythology)
body:
A [[unicorn]]-like auspicious creature in Chinese mythology. Usually appears as a mix of an [[eastern dragon]], a [[horse]], and a [[deer]].

The creature's name transliterates to "kirin" in Japanese, "girin"/"kirin" in Korean, and "kì lân"/"kỳ lân" in Vietnamese; these terms are also used in their respective languages to refer to the common [[giraffe]]. [[Kirin (company)|Kirin Brewery]] uses this creature for the company name and logo illustration. (Some of Kirin's soft drinks don't use this logo, though.)

Both qilins and [[kirin (Final Fantasy)|]]s appear in Square's [[Final Fantasy XI]], but their shapes are far different from the original folklore. 

h4. See also

* [[Kirin]] 
* [[Kirin (company)]] 
* [[Tag Group:Legendary Creatures]]

h4.External links

* "Wikipedia: Qilin":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qilin

body: Slan is the only female member of the God Hand in [[Berserk]]. She appears in the form of a succubus with black leathery wings and vine-like hair. title: sudachi_(fruit)
body: A specialty of Tokushima Prefecture, Japan, is a small, round, green citrus [[fruit]]. It is a tart citrus that is not eaten as a fruit, but rather as a food flavoring instead of [[lemon]] or [[lime_(fruit)|lime]]. Genetic analysis shows that it is the product of a cross between Yuzu and another citrus similar to the Takanori [[orange (fruit)|]] and koji orange.

title: thug_life
body:
"Thug Life" is an American Expression that describes a way of life for people who face many adversities and dificulties throughout life, but who never give up fighting for their goals and dreams. i.e. hoodrat living. Eventually became a [[meme]] used to describe dominance of any kind done with nonchalance, usually associated with American street thugs stereotypes.

Usually appeared with [[deal with it (meme)|]] glasses (aka "Thug Life glasses" due to its usage), and it is a subset of [[MLG]] memes.

title: matilda_(world_witches_series)
body:
Character from [[Witches Of Africa]].

Servant and bodyguard of [[Hanna-Justina Marseille]], she hails from the south of Africa, and her real name, age, and birthday are unknown. Despite possesing a land Striker unit, she is not an official member of the military, and despite being a witch, she does not posess a familiar. Although she owns a 3.7cm KwK36 Witch Combat Gun, she prefers fighting with an Assegai spear, a sling, and a Nguni shield. Known to be afraid of heights.

She's based on Matthias Letulu, a South Africa prisoner of war who became a close friend to Hans-Joachim Marseille.

title: winner's_circle
body:
German board game themed on horse race betting. Players place their bets and then take turns moving horses to the finish line. The winner is the player who gained the most amount of money at the end of the game (after a predetermined number of races).

Known as "Royal Turf" in the original German release, as well as in some import markets such as Japan. There is some variation in rules between different versions of the game.

body:

The Bulldozer, true to it's name, are an indomitable force to be reckoned with for the cops. He wears an [[bomb_suit|EOD suit]] outfitted to be able to sustain a lot of damage from bullets whilst wielding either [[shotgun]]s, [[light_machine_gun|LMGs]] or even a [[minigun]].
Their face is also protected with a plate before revealing it's glass visor and the head underneath the helmet.

title: jane_t._godfrey
body:
Character from [[Strike Witches: Kurenai no Majo-tachi]].

A Flight Lieutenant from Liberion serving in the [[504th Joint Fighter Wing]]. She's in a relationship with [[Dominica S. Gentile]], for whom she serves as wingman.
Her familiar is the dalmatian, her weapons are a Browning M2 machine gun and a Browning M1918 rifle, and she's based on John T. Godfrey.

title: laura_toth
body:
Character from [[Strike Witches: Katayoku no Majo-tachi]]

A Pilot Officer form Ostmark serving in the [[Isle of Wight Detachment Group]]. She has a skill called Sense Acceleration (感覚加速) which greatly enhaces her reflexes, allowing her to process information faster and dodge attacks with ease.

Her weapon is a MG 42, her familiar is the Tyrolean hound, and she's based on Lajos Tóth.

body:
Character from [[Strike Witches: Katayoku no Majo-tachi]]

A Pilot Officer from Liberion serving in the [[Isle of Wight Detachment Group]]. She has a skill called Sprinting which gives her instantenous speed boosts to make tight turns, similar to [[Charlotte E. Yeager]]'s skill.

Her weapons include a M1918 Browning Automatic Rifle, a M9 Grenade carrier, and a M1A1 machine gun, and her familiar is the pony.

title: kadomaru_misa
body:
Character from [[Strike Witches: Katayoku no Majo-tachi]]

A Flying Officer from Fuso serving as commander of [[Isle of Wight Detachment Group]]. She has a skill called Vajra Strength  (金剛力) which allows her to inject her magical energy inside objects to destroy them.

Her weapons are a M1919A6 machine gun and a short sword that she uses as a intermediary to drive her power into the enemy. Her familiar is the extinct Hinata dog, and she's based on Kanamaru Teizou.

title: splendid_screen
body: An unlockable secondary for [[Demoman (tf2)|]] in [[Team Fortress 2]]. An iron shield with 4 different styles to choose from. Unlike the [[Chargin' Targe]], it delivers higher damage when bashing an enemy, but has lower damage resistance to fire and explosions.

title: milkor_mgl
body:
A South African [[grenade launcher]] that is notable for its [[revolver]]-like reloading system. It used by the United States military under the designation M32.

This weapon is mostly associated with [[Demoman (tf2)|]] of [[Team Fortress 2]].

* [[grenade launcher]]

title: persian_persuader
body: An unlockable melee weapon for [[Demoman (tf2)|]] in [[Team Fortress 2]]. It is a scimitar with blood stained on the edge of it's blade. Unlike the [[Eyelander]], it's charge meter can be filled quicker by collecting ammo packs. It's hilt is shaped like the Loch Ness Monster.

title: chargin'_targe
body: An unlockable secondary weapon for [[Demoman (tf2)|]] in [[Team Fortress 2]]. It is a wooden shield the makes the player charge forward with guaranteed crits for a few seconds. It is often paired with the [[Eyelander]].

title: frontier_justice
body: One of the unlockable primary weapons for [[Engineer (tf2)|]] in [[Team Fortress 2]]. Grants the player crits if their [[Sentry]] is destroyed, based on how many kills it dealt.

title: golden_wrench
body:
[i]At least you ain't worthless anymore![/i]
-- [[Engineer (tf2)|]] after killing someone with the golden wrench.

A special version of the wrench for the Engineer in [[Team Fortress 2]]. Anyone who is killed by it will turn solid Australium, with special voice lines upon kill. The wrench was distributed to 100 random people when the Engineer Update dropped.

body: An unlockable primary weapon for [[Pyro (tf2)|]] in [[Team Fortress 2]]. It's slightly faster deploy speed and holstering speed make it more efficient for combo attacks.

title: rainblower
body: A reskin of [[Pyro (tf2)|]]'s stock flamethrower in [[Team Fortress 2]]. It is shaped like a brass tuba/horn instrument that shoots rainbows and bubbles instead of fire. It was first introduced in the [i]Meet The Pyro[/i] video, and equipping it will take the player to [[Pyroland]].

title: pyroland
body: A fantasy land based on [[Pyro (tf2)|]]'s vision in [[Team Fortress 2]]'s Meet The Pyro. All screaming is replaced with laughing happily, and all violence becomes entertainment and jokes.

title: backburner
body: An unlockable primary weapon for [[Pyro (tf2)|]] in [[Team Fortress 2]]. It deals crits when burning enemies from behind.

title: sharpened_volcano_fragment
body: The Sharpened Volcano Fragment is a promotional melee weapon for [[Pyro (tf2)|]] in [[Team Fortress 2]]. It is an obsidian axe with glowing lava flowing along the blade's extreme edges.

title: spy-cicle
body: An unlockable melee weapon for [[Spy (tf2)|]] in [[Team Fortress 2]]. An icicle which will turn enemies into solid ice when backstabbed. If the player is ignited while carrying it, it will extinguish them by melting.

title: necro_smasher
body: An unlockable melee for all classes (except [[Spy (tf2)|]]) in [[Team Fortress 2]]. It is a hammer that resembles a miniature version of the hammer used for the strongman game in the Halloween mode map "Carnival of Carnage". It can be unlocked by completing any 4 achievements for the map.

title: red_tape_recorder
body: An unlockable sapper weapon for [[Spy (tf2)|]] in [[Team Fortress 2]]. Instead of destroying a building, it will reverse its upgrades until it's nothing more than a toolbox. Slowing down the noise the tape recorder emits will play "Let's make some noise...".

title: heles
body:

She has [[long hair|long]] [[silver hair]] in a [[single braid]] and [[yellow eyes]]. As an Erun, she naturally has [[cat ears]]. She wears a [[short dress|short]] [[armored dress|armored]] [[white dress]], gold [[hair tubes]], and a blue [[hairband]] that creates subtle [[hair intakes]].  Her choice of weapon is a [[spear]].

She is [[Seruel]]'s older sister, thus the two share the same hair colour, eye colour, and cat ears.

Natsuki has [[purple eyes]] and [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[ahoge]] which she wears in a [[ponytail]].

title: retention_stance
body: A shooting stance meant to prevent enemies from taking your gun when fighting in close quarters. Usually involves [[holding gun|holding the gun]] close to the body.

title: 507th_joint_fighter_wing
body:
The 507th Joint Fighter Wing is a volunteer group previously called the Suomus Independent Volunteer Aerial Squadron. To many, they bear the nickname "Silent Witches" or, less flatteringly, the "Suomus Misfit Squadron" in reference to the reputation of some squad members. As per the name, it is stationed in Suomus. They are the subject of the '[[Strike Witches: Suomus Misfits Squadron]]" light novels.

The tag should ideally refer to most (5+) of the squadron together.

h6. Original members

*  Flight Lieutenant [[Anabuki Tomoko]]
*  Flying Officer [[Elizabeth F. Beurling]]
*  Flying Officer [[Elma Leivonen]]
*  Warrant Officer  [[Giuseppina Ciuinni]]
*  Pilot Office [[Katharine Ohare]]
*  Flying Officer [[Ursula Hartmann]]
*  Flying Officer [[Sakomizu Haruka]]
* Major [[Hakkinen]]

h6. Members after reformation
* Wing Commander [[Sakomizu Haruka]]
* Flight Lieutenant [[Hanna Wind]]
* [[Vesna Mikovic]]
* [[Misumi Miya]]
* Flying Officer [[Leigh Andrea Archer]]
* Flight Sergeant [[Kullamas Blengkam]]

title: leigh_andrea_archer
body:
Character from [[Brave Witches]].

A Flying Officer from Liberion originally belongining to the Tuskegee Airwitches of African-Liberion witches before being transfered to the [[507th Joint Fighter Wing]].

Her weapon is an M2 Browning, her familiar is the puma, and she's based on Lee Andrew Archer Jr.
other_names: リー・アンドレア・アーチャー

title: kullamas_blengkam
body:
Character from [[Brave Witches]].

A Sergeant from Siamro (equivalent to Thailand) and a member of the reforme [[507th Joint Fighter Wing]]. Formerly part of the Siamro Kingdom 16th Squadron, she's nicknamed Broi (gem).

Her weapon is a Ho-103 machine gun. Her familiar is the Siamese cat, and she's based on Kamrop Blengkam.
other_names: クラマース・ブレンガーム

title: sakomizu_haruka
body:
Character from [[Strike Witches: Suomus Misfits Squadron]].

A Flying Officer (Wing Commander in the reformed unit) from Fuso serving in the [[507th Joint Fighter Wing]]. Known for her crush on [[Anabuki Tomoko]], and her competition with [[Giuseppina Ciuinni]] over her attention. She has poor eyesight, but usually refuses to wear her coke-bottle glasses.

Her weapons include a Type 99-1, a Type 99-2 Model 2 Kai, and Type 94 pistol. Her original design shows her familiar is a calico cat, but this was changed to a  tanuki. Fanart may depict her as either. She's not based on any real pilot.

title: hakkinen
body:
Character from [[Strike Witches: Suomus Misfits Squadron]].

Unlike most characters in the series, she's not a witch but a normal woman. She's a captain serving as the Base Commander and Aerospace Control officer for the [[507th Joint Fighter Wing]]. Official art has shown her cosplaying as a witch with [[cat ears]] and a [[cat tail]], and holding a Suomus KP/31.

title: kadokura_kokono
body: A heroine of the game [[migite ga tomaranai boku to osananajimi no shimai|Migite ga Tomaranai Boku to, Osananajimi no Shimai]], released in 2004 by Waffle.

title: kadokura_miyabi
body: A heroine of the game [[migite ga tomaranai boku to osananajimi no shimai|Migite ga Tomaranai Boku to, Osananajimi no Shimai]], released in 2004 by Waffle.

title: migite_ga_tomaranai_boku_to_osananajimi_no_shimai
body: Migite ga Tomaranai Boku to, Osananajimi no Shimai is a game released by Waffle in 2010. It was illustrated by [[Sakuya Tsuitachi]].
other_names: 右手がとまらない僕と、幼なじみの姉妹

title: suiei_kyoushitsu
body: Suiei Kyoushitsu ~Fuyu de mo School Mizugi~ is a game released by Waffle in 2004. It was illustrated by [[Sakuya Tsuitachi]].
other_names: 水泳教室~冬でもスクール水着~

title: shimomura_kotone
body:
A heroine of the game [[Suiei Kyoushitsu|Suiei Kyoushitsu ~Fuyu de mo School Mizugi~]], released in 2004 by Waffle.

A third grade student and the daughter of the Shimomura Swimming School, located a short distance away from the academy the main character Touya attends. She is well-known throughout the country for her swimming and has already been recommended for admission to the school. She is also active as an instructor in the infant and beginner swim classes, and she is instructing Touya, who has joined the beginners' course.

Her hobbies are fortune-telling, swimming, and watching yakuza movies.

title: hazuki_mao_(suiei_kyoushitsu)
body:
A heroine of the game [[Suiei Kyoushitsu|Suiei Kyoushitsu ~Fuyu de mo School Mizugi~]], released in 2004 by Waffle.

A second year student and classmate of the main character, Touya, and has been friends with [[Shimomura Kotone|Kotone]] since they were children. She has participated in national swimming tournaments and is a regular competitor, but her academics are weak. Since they sit together in class, she became fast friends with Touya and he often helps her to study.

Her hobbies are collecting US toys and comics, and watching martial arts.

title: inaba_naho
body:
A heroine of the game [[Suiei Kyoushitsu|Suiei Kyoushitsu ~Fuyu de mo School Mizugi~]], released in 2004 by Waffle.

She is the sister-in-law of the main character, Touya, and a first-year student at the same academy. Unlike her extroverted brother-in-law, she has a very introverted personality, however, she is able to express her feelings honestly to her family, especially to Touya. Her parents were hesitant to let her out of their home because of her shyness, but allowed her to enter the school on the premise that she would live with Touya. 

Her hobbies are appreciation of biographical works, such as movies and books, and playing video games.

title: gakuko
body:
A [[genderswap|female version]] of [[Vocaloid]] [[Kamui Gakupo]].

h4. See also

* [[List of Vocaloid derivatives]]

title: ursula_hartmann
body:
[[Strike Witches: Suomus Misfits Squadron]] and [[Strike Witches]] character.

A Flying Sergeant from Karlsland serving in the [[507th Joint Fighter Wing]]. She is [[Erica Hartmann]]'s twin sister. The polar opposite of her sister in personality, she's quiet and intellectual, having worked on the development of Striker Units and weapons. What she has in common with Erica is ignoring other people and going at her own pace.

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]] with [[glasses]]. Her weapons include an MG34, a MG131, a MG151/15, and a [[Fliegerhammer]]. Her original design shows her familiar is the Dachshund just like her sister, but this was changed to a badger. She's based on Ursula Paetsch, Erich Hartmann's wife.
other_names: ウルスラ・ハルトマン

title: katharine_ohare
body:
Character from [[Strike Witches: Suomus Misfits Squadron]].

A Pilot Officer from Liberion serving in the [[507th Joint Fighter Wing]]. Known as "Crasher O'Hare" due to her propensity fro crashing her Striker Unit (either by clumsiness or bad luck).

Her weapons include a M2 Heavy Machine Gun, a M1919 A6, a Breda-SAFAT 12.7 mm machine gun, and a Colt SAA Revolver. In her original desigin, her familiar is the Abyssinian cat, but this was later changed to a raccoon, and she's based on Butch O'Hare.

title: x68000
body:
The [b]X68000[/b], often referred to as the X68k, is a Japanese computer home computer sold by the [[Sharp Corporation]] around the late 1980s to early 1990s. 
The CPU (MPU) was a Motorola MC68000, its successor the X68030 had a MC68EC030, and because of the unique body design, which looked like the [[world trade center]], the case was nicknamed as "Manhattan Shaped." 
It had an advantage against its competitors, such as the Fujitsu [[FM TOWNS]] and the NEC [[PC-98 (computer)|]] series, regarding its usefulness for games, programming, and other hobbies. 
Those who use(d) this computer are/were often regarded as computer geeks. 

h4.See also 

* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/X68000

title: giuseppina_ciuinni
body:
Character from [[Strike Witches: Suomus Misfits Squadron]].

A Warrant Officer from Romagna serving in the [[507th Joint Fighter Wing]]. Pioneer of the skip-bombing technique.

Her weapon is an 12.7mm SAFAT Machine gun, her familiar is the wild cat, and she' based on Giuseppe Cenni.
other_names: ジュゼッピーナ・チュインニ

title: kouhai-chan_(tawawa)
body:
A character from [i][[Getsuyoubi no Tawawa]][/i]. Presently the second most frequently recurring character in the series, and the second female protagonist of the ONA.

A clumsy yet reliable office lady. Her name derives from the junior-senior relationship between her and [[senpai (tawawa)|Senpai]], her male colleague that almost always accompanies her in her appearances. Senpai is particularly protective of her, especially since she is very prone to putting herself in compromising situations while drunk.

She is voiced by [[Kayano Ai]].

title: eriko_(real)_(princess_connect!)
body:
A character from [[Princess Connect!]] and Princess Connect! Re:Dive. [spoiler]Kuraishi Eriko (倉石 恵理子), the "player" of [[Eriko (princess connect!)|]] in the real world.[/spoiler]

She has [[red eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair|brown]] to [[black hair]] stylized in a [[inverted bob]] cut with [[blunt bangs]]. She usually wears a [[school uniform]] or a [[black dress]].

title: elma_leivonen
body:
Character from [[Strike Witches: Suomus Misfits Squadron]].

A Flying Officer from Suomus serving in the [[507th Joint Fighter Wing]]. She used to be the commander of the unit before giving the position to [[Anabuki Tomoko]]. She's an old friend of [[Eila Ilmatar Juutilainen]].

Unlike most witches, she's not based on any real-life ace pilot. Her weapons are a Lahti-Saloranta M/26 LMG and 12.7mm SAFAT Machine guns, and her familiar is the mink.
other_names: エルマ・レイヴォネン

title: elizabeth_f._beurling
body:
[[Strike Witches: Suomus Misfits Squadron]] character.

Elizabeth F. Beurling is a witch in the [[507th Joint Fighter Wing]] (AKA "Silent Witches", AKA "Suomus Misfits"). Her home country is "Faraway Land", which is a Britannian commonwealth that is analogous to Canada. Her familiar was originally the dachshund, however was later canonically changed to the Irish Setter. Her weapons are a Bren Mk. 1 Light Machinegun and a Gurkha knife. Her hair is brown in the ilustratons but described as grey in the prose.

Elizabeth is the "bad girl" of the Suomus Misfits: she is cold and often distant in demeanor, feeling no need to engage in niceties and openly resentful of authority or bureaucracy. Furthermore, she is a chain smoker and likely an alcoholic. Under this exterior, however, is a girl who is fond and even protective of her squadmates. Her relationship with [[Elma Leivonen]] and [[Anabuki Tomoko]], in particular, are portrayed as close, if tumultuous.

Elizabeth is based on the #1 ranked Canadian RCAF ace George F. Beurling, known varyingly as the "Malta Spitfire" and "The Knight of Malta" for his success in the area. Both carried reputations for resenting authority, a sometimes astounding natural talent for aerial combat, and switching corps, however unlike Elizabeth, George was a strict non-smoker.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: George Beurling":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Beurling
other_names: エリザベス・F・ビューリング

title: ayatsuji_ayase
body: Ayase Ayatsuji is the daughter of Kaito Ayatsuji hailed as the Last Samurai and the late Ayako Ayatsuji. Differing from her father, she was a Blazer and training in the Ayatsuji Ittou-ryuu, but this came to an end after the brutal attack of the Sword Eater who put her father into a coma. Ayase became a third-year student in Hagun Academy and had the intent to enter the 62nd Seven Stars Sword Art Festival to win back the Ayatsuji Dojo from Kuraudo.

title: toudou_touka
body: Touka Toudou is a third-year student in Hagun Academy and also the current Student Council President known as Raikiri. Before her defeat at the hands of Ikki Kurogane in the Hagun Selection Battle Finals, she was known as the strongest student in Hagun Academy.

title: litoco
body:
Litoco is the mascot character of the adult game developer Little Witch. She was designed by [[Oyari Ashito]].

Her page on the Little Witch website can be found "here":[https://web.archive.org/web/20030402223544/http://www.littlewitch.co.jp/llr/index.html].

title: lyria_(cutie_apron)_(granblue_fantasy)
body: The white apron that [[lyria_(granblue_fantasy)|Lyria]] loves to wear while on kitchen duty. The ribbons on the bib and pockets were sewn on by the blue-haired girl herself while under [[katalina_(granblue_fantasy)|Katalina's]] tutelage.

title: lyria_(born_to_be_snowdos)_(granblue_fantasy)
body: [[Lyria_(granblue_fantasy)|Lyria]] in her rock star outfit from "The Doss! End of the Line Farewell Tour" event where she debuts in the [[Aoidos]] band known as "Snowdos".

title: lyria_(daughter_of_pearl)_(granblue_fantasy)
body: [[Lyria_(granblue_fantasy)|Lyria's]] swimsuit, whipped up so she could enjoy the beach to the fullest. The colorful decorations blend perfectly with the cute, carefree design.

title: belial_(summer)_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[belial_(granblue_fantasy)|Belial]] in his summer outfit.

The fallen angel of cunning never doubts the irresistible charm granted to him by his glorious creator, using it to enthrall others into doing his bidding or to satisfy his innermost desires. Whether the waterdrops dripping down his bare skin are reflecting the sun's rays or the apocalypse's light is anyone's guess.

title: vane_(sunrise_hakama)_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[vane_(granblue fantasy)|Vane]] in his new year 2019 outfit.

A hakama modeled after the dawn, with light gold and cypress bark colors fusing together seamlessly. When the mad roaring lion dances to the beat of festival music, a fortuitous spring breeze is sure to flow.

title: heles_(summer)_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[Heles]] in her swimsuit.

This princess travels afar in hopes of enriching her royal subjects. When she and her allies make merry on the beaches of Auguste, an unexpected fortune presents itself to her.

title: izmir_(summer)_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[Izmir]] in her swimsuit.

A young woman of ice, she sticks out like a sore thumb upon the crew's arrival at a resort in perpetual summer. Accepting that her fate will soon catch up to her, she holds onto the precious moments spent with her fellow skyfarers while anticipating their eventual parting.

title: samuel_rodrigues
body:
Antagonist/rival character in [[Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance]]. Also known as Jetstream Sam, he is a Brazilian-Japanese mercenary with a samurai family ancestry, with a penchant for iaido and a seemingly carefree personality.

He was forced to work with [[Steven Armstrong|Senator Armstrong]] after being overpowered in a short battle between them. [spoiler]Disgusted with Armstrong's Social Darwinism ideology, he later secretly turns against him. After that, he duelled with [[Raiden (metal gear)|]] to the death to solve their differences and to prove that Raiden is capable of defeating Armstrong using his high-quality blade, even knowing that his human body is no match to Raiden's cybernetic body[/spoiler].

His image song / boss theme is "The Only Thing I Know For Real".

He is voiced by Philip Anthony-Rodriguez in North America, and by [[Hirata Hiroaki]] in Japan.

title: madam_m
body:
Madam M is a minor supporting character in [[Final Fantasy VII Remake]]. She runs a reputable massage parlor in the Wall Market district of Sector 6.  Along with [[Andrea Rhodea]] and [[Chocobo Sam]], she is also a member of the Trio—a group of high-profile figures who act as scouts for [[Don Corneo]]'s nightly bridal auditions, approving candidates.

She has [[pale skin]], [[black hair]] pinned up with elaborate golden [[hairpin]]s, dark [[brown eyes]], and sports purple [[eyeshadow]] and [[red lips]]. She wears an [[off shoulder]] [[black kimono]] with a golden [[floral print]] pattern and a pair of black [[geta]] sandals, and carries a [[folding fan]] that matches her kimono.

title: kenzaki_ameri
body:
Kenzaki Ameri is a girl with a secret double life as the masked superhero Lady Justice, as well as the love interest of the series' main character.

h1. Appearance
Kenzaki was naturally born with heterochromia and with an unnatural blue streak in her otherwise black hair. She hides both of these features when she's at school, using a colored contact to cover up her yellow eye and a hairpin to cover up her blue hair highlight.

h1. Powers
Kenzaki Ameri was born with a full set of superpowers for reasons that are still unknown to her. Those powers include:

* Superhuman strength
* Invulnerability
* Flight
* Super speed
* Super breath
* A right eye that can see into peoples' hearts
* A left eye that can see things that are miles away and see through walls
* A sixth sense that detects evil nearby

In terms of physical strength, Kenzaki is so strong that she can easily blow other superhumans away with a single punch using only a fraction of a percent of her full strength. Her invulnerability has no known limits. She once took a direct hit from a bomb that was twice as powerful as the strongest nuclear weapon ever recorded, and it didn't even scratch her.

He designed and made Lady Justice's uniform himself and also fixes it whenever it gets damaged. He has short blond hair, glasses, and is usually shown wearing his school uniform.

title: lady_justice_(series)
body: Lady Justice was a short-lived manga published by Shonen Jump. It debuted in May of 2015 before being cancelled in September of the same year after only releasing two volumes. Written and drawn by [[Ogino_Ken]], the series was about a high school boy who has a crush on Kenzaki Ameri, a girl who he soon learns has a secret double life as the masked superhero, Lady Justice!

title: dirty_deeds_done_dirt_cheap
body:
[[Stand (jojo)|]] power of [[Funny Valentine]] from [[Steel Ball Run]]. Usually abbreviated as [b]D4C[/b] due to its long name. Manifests as a white/pink humanoid with large "horns" resembling rabbit ears.

[spoiler]Grants Valentine the power to travel to parallel worlds, even being able to bring people across with him. Should something or somebody from one world meet their counterpart in another, they will be both be destroyed. Valentine is immune to this effect, and can change places with a "parallel" Valentine should he come close to dying, with all memories transferring over.[/spoiler]

Namesake is the song and album [i]Dirty Deeds Done Dirt Cheap[/i] by Australian rock band AC/DC. In the English translation, the name was changed to [i]Filthy Acts at a Reasonable Price[/i] to avoid copyright infringement. The Japanese transliteration of the stand's name (especially the copyright compliant version) "いともたやすく行われるえげつない行為" has become a [[neta|local meme tag]] used to refer to any mischievous acts done by a character, either with minimal effort or through blatant cheating.
other_names: ダーティー・ディース・ダン・ダート・チープ

title: guy_fawkes_mask
body:
The Guy Fawkes [[mask ]] is a stylised depiction of Guy Fawkes, the best-known member of the Gunpowder Plot, an attempt to blow up the House of Lords in London on 5 November 1605.

One version of the mask gained [[meme_attire|memetic status]] after being worn by [[V_(V_for_Vendetta)|the title character]] of the movie [[V for Vendetta]]. Typically associated with vigilante and the "Anonymous" hacker group.

title: akamatsu_ken
body:
赤松 健 (Akamatsu Ken) is a Japanese mangaka, born in Kanagawa prefecture, Japan, on July 5, 1968. Most of his works fall into the "harem" genre and feature ecchi material.

In his teenage years, Akamatsu failed the entrance exam to Tokyo University, and applied for Film Study instead (it is speculated that this is where he got the idea for Love Hina). Eventually, he became famous as an illustrator featured in Comiket (short for Comic Market, a comic convention bi-annually held in Japan). He used the pen name Awa Mizuno (水野 亜和, Mizuno Awa "[1]":[#dtext-external-links]). Akamatsu, still in college, then proceeded to win the Weekly Shonen Magazine award twice. His "A Kid's Game for One Summer" was awarded the coveted 50th Shonen Magazine Newcomer's Award soon after he graduated.

After a big hit with [[ai_ga_tomaranai!|A・I ga Tomaranai!]] (A.I. Love You), he finally made a grand success with his new manga, [[Love Hina]]. The series appeared in Weekly Shonen Magazine and has been collected in eleven volumes (with fourteen volumes in total), which have sold over 6 million copies in Japan, and received the Kodansha Manga Award for shōnen in 2001. Akamatsu had added elements of his own life experiences to the story, and this was said to have induced a unique feeling to the manga especially for Western readers, whose lack of familiarity with Japanese culture for the most part added to the effect. The series, published in America in 2002, was especially well received in many overseas countries - Akamatsu was surprised that even foreign readers found Love Hina to be "cute" and to their liking.

He is married to his wife 'Kanon' Akamatsu. Love Hina and the his manga after that, [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]] (Negima!: Magister Negi Magi), were made into an anime series produced by XEBEC. A second independent retelling of Negima by SHAFT was made called [b]Negima!?[/b] "[2]":[#dtext-external-links], but it never reached the popularity of the first series or [[Love Hina]]. It is has also been aired as a live action series. 

His current manga is [[UQ Holder!]], a story in the same universe as Negima. It received an anime adaptation by JC Staff that was based on a backup plot.

He later announced in December 2021 he would be running in the summer 2022 elections for a seat in the House of Councillors, the upper house of Japan's House of Representatives, through a nationwide proportional district with a platform "to protect freedom of expression, artistic freedom and creators' rights in Japan from foreign and domestic puritan and politically correct censorship, standards, regulations and influences" according to Wikipedia. His campaign was a success.

h4. Works

h5. Manga Works

* [[Itsudatte My Santa!]]
* [[AI ga Tomaranai!]]
* [[Love Hina]]
* [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]]
* [[UQ Holder!]]

h5. Anime Works

* [[Love Hina]]
* [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]]
* [[Rikujou Boueitai Mao-chan]] (Ground Defense Force! Mao-chan) (story, character designs)
* [[Itsudatte My Santa!]]
* [b]Negima!?[/b] "[2]":[#dtext-external-links]

h5. Live Action Works

* Magister Negi Magi: Mahou Sensei Negima!!

h4.See also

[2] Anime DB: "Negima!?":https://anidb.net/anime/4565

title: biggs_(ff7)
body:
Biggs is a supporting character in the Final Fantasy VII series, with a minor supporting role in [[Final Fantasy VII]] and a major supporting role in [[Final Fantasy VII Remake]]. He is a core member of [[Barret Wallace]]’s independent Avalanche cell along with [[Wedge (FF7)]] and [[Jessie Rasberry]].

Biggs is the strategist, responsible for planning out their missions. He is calm and rational in contrast to Barret's volatility, and is very close to Wedge and Jessie. He is affectionate with children. Not one to fight on the front lines often, he takes on more of a support role in Avalanche.

title: wedge_(ff7)
body: Wedge is a supporting character in the Final Fantasy VII series, with a minor supporting role in [[Final Fantasy VII]] and a major supporting role in [[Final Fantasy VII Remake]]. He is a core member of [[Barret Wallace]]’s independent Avalanche cell along with [[Biggs (FF7)]] and [[Jessie Rasberry]].

title: moggie_(ff7r)
body:
Moggie is a minor character in [[Final Fantasy VII Remake]]. He is a young boy living in the Sector 5 Slums who dresses in a [[moogle]] costume, resembling the moogle from the Chocobo & Moogle summon. He runs the Moogle Emporium where the player can buy items with Moogle Medals, special coins earned from smashing boxes, from treasures, and from playing Whack-a-Box.

Moggie believes himself to truly be a moogle, even interjecting random "kupos" into his speech, while stating that Cloud and Aerith can only see him due to their pure hearts.

title: betty_(ff7)
body: Betty is a minor character in [[Final Fantasy VII Remake]]. She lives in the Sector 7 slums of Midgar with her father and is close friends with [[Marlene Wallace]]. She takes care of three cats.

title: oates_(ff7r)
body: Oates, known as Mugi (ムギ) in Japanese, is a minor character in [[Final Fantasy VII Remake]]. He is a young boy living in the Sector 5 Slums. He seems to distrust many adults, but does like [[Aerith Gainsborough]], and asks for her help when things go awry.  He hangs out at the slum kids' "secret playground" that leads to their hideout, and acts as something of a spokesperson for the collective of slum kids when dealing with Aerith and Cloud.

title: aggressive_retsuko
body:
[b]Aggretsuko[/b], also known by its original Japanese title Aggressive Retsuko, is a Japanese animated comedy streaming television series based on the eponymous character [[Retsuko]] created by "Yeti" for the mascot company [[Sanrio]].

An original net animation (ONA) anime series adaptation was launched worldwide on [[Netflix]] in April 2018.

title: master_core
body:
Upon taking enough damage in certain environments, [[Master Hand]] will painfully transform into a bright core surrounded by a dark, writhing [[eldritch_abomination|abomination]] called the Swarm. 

Master Core has six known forms:

h6. Master Giant
A large, humanoid titan that is capable of spawning multiple hands and creating shockwaves from screaming.

h6. Master Beast
A bizarre chimera that likes to attack with spikes from its back and body slams.

h6. Master Edges/Sabres
A living barrage of swords that will erratically attack with unpredicatble patterns.

h6. Master Shadow
This form assumes the appearance of its opponent, right down to their alternate costume and any additional customizations. This form can either be depleted of its HP or knocked out of the stage.

h6. Master Fortress
A...[i]thing[/i] that is effectively an entire stage. It must be travered in order to destroy a series of cores while avoiding various obstacles along the way.

h6. Master Core
With nothing else to throw at its opponent, the Core finally shows itself. Unlike the previous forms, Master Core can only be defeated by knocking it off the stage. It does not attack in this state, but if it is still on the stage after some time, it will release a series of powerful energy rings before self-destructing.

body: Boku no Natsuyasumi (ぼくのなつやすみ, lit. "My Summer Vacation") is a video game developed by Millennium Kitchen and published by Sony Computer Entertainment for the PlayStation. It is part of the popular Boku no Natsuyasumi series and was released in Japan on June 22, 2000. A PlayStation Portable port was released on June 27, 2006. title: cetitan
body:
A species of [[Pokemon_(creature)|Pokémon]] introduced in [[Pokemon SV]]

    Category: Terra Whale Pokémon
    Type: Ice
    Height: 14'9"
    Weight: 1,543.2 lbs.
    Ability: Thick Fat / Slush Rush

[quote]Strong Muscles and Thick Blubber
Cetitan need to have tough muscles to be able to support their immense bodies, and physical attacks using their bodies have incredible power. They also migrate around the snowy regions, protected by a thick layer of subcutaneous fat.

The Horn on the Upper Jaw Freezes the Surroundings
A Cetitan has five hard horns. Among them, the horn on the upper jaw is able to gather ice energy, making the surrounding temperature extremely low and freezing the area around the Pokémon. [/quote]

title: datsun
body: An automobile marque. The name was created in 1931 by the DAT Motorcar Co. for a new car model, spelling it as "Datson" to indicate its smaller size when compared to the existing, larger DAT car. In 1934, after [[Nissan|Nissan Motor Co., Ltd]]. took control of DAT Motorcar Co., the last syllable of Datson was changed to "sun", because "son" also means "loss" (損) in Japanese, and also to honour the sun depicted in the national flag, hence the name "Datsun" : Dattosan (ダットサン Dattosan). Nissan phased out the Datsun brand by March 1986. The Datsun name is most famous for the 510, [[Nissan Fairlady|Fairlady]] roadsters and later the [[Nissan Fairlady Z|Fairlady Z]] (240Z) coupes. On March 20, 2012, it was announced that Nissan will revive the brand for use in Indonesia, India and Russia.

title: contra_dual_spirits
body:
[b][i]Contra: Dual Spirits[/i][/b] (魂斗羅 デュアルスピリッツ), released in the United States as [b][i]Contra 4[/i][/b], is a 2D shooter [[video game]] for the [[Nintendo DS]] and the eleventh original installment in the Contra series. 

The game was released in North America on November 13, 2007 and in Japan on March 13, 2008. Contra 4 was produced by [[Konami]] Digital Entertainment in America and developed by WayForward Technologies, making it the first Contra game developed by a foreign western company, as well as the first original Contra game for a portable platform since the 1991 [[Game Boy]] game [i]Operation C[/i]. 

As the game's title indicates, Contra 4 was designed to be a direct sequel to the Contra games for the Nintendo Entertainment System and [[Super Nintendo]] ([[Contra]], [[Super Contra]], and [[Contra III The Alien Wars]]), with a gameplay model similar to those games. In celebration of the 20th anniversary of the original Contra the game also includes several playable characters from many different Contra games.

h4. Some playable characters

* [[Bill Rizer]]
* [[Lance Bean]]
* [[Probotector]]
* [[Mad Dog (Contra)]] 
* [[Scorpion (Contra)]]
* [[Lucia (Contra)]]
* [[Sheena Etranzi]]
other_names: 魂斗羅デュアルスピリッツ

title: haku_sanshi
body:
[[Haku_Sanshi|Haku Sanshi]] ([b]白汕子[/b]), most commonly known as simply [i]Sanshi[/i], is [[Taiki (juuni kokuki)|]]'s [[nyokai]]. She has the torso of a woman, the eyes of a fish, limbs of a leopard, and a [[lizard_tail|tail of a lizard]]; she is considered well-mixed as a nyokai because she has many different beastly features.
She was in care of [[Taiki (juuni kokuki)|]] and educated him in his role as the [i]kirin of Tai[/i].
Her first appearance was in the second novel from [[juuni_kokuki|"The Twelve Kingdoms"]] series [i][b]"Sea of the Wind, Shore of the Labyrinth"[/b] (風の海 迷宮の岸)[/i].
In the anime adaptation she was voiced by [i]Masako Katsuki[/i].

title: nadine_chandrawinata
body:
A playable character from [[Black Survival]]. An Indonesian huntress who is forced to participate in Aglaia's experiments on Lumia Island. Nadine lost her parents in a landslide accident when she was 4 years old and was subsequently raised by animals. She was found 8 years later by a hunter who attempted to reintegrate her into human society, but she has great difficulty with human customs. Nadine is being studied by Aglaia due to her nearly perfect immune system, as she has never gotten sick.

Has [[dark skin]], [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair]], [[brown eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Typically fights with either a [[bow_(weapon)|longbow]] or a [[crossbow]].

title: electric_kettle
body:
A [[kettle]] with an integrated heating element.  Generally distinguishable from stovetop kettles by featuring a window to view the water level, having control buttons on it, having a port to connect to its electric base, or simply having an electric cord coming out of it.  Many such electric kettles feature a metal and plastic exterior.  Some feature all glass sides, but not a glass bottom given the presence of the heating element in the base.

h4. See also

* [[Water boiler]] (a similar electric appliance used for heating water)

h4. External link

* "Wikipedia: Electric kettles":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kettle#Electric_kettles]

title: 12_billion_yen_incident
body: References to an infamous [[real life|real-life]] incident involving [[Gold Ship (racehorse)|]] (the racehorse) causing betting 'losses' of approximately twelve billion yen. The actual incident happened at the 2015 [[Takarazuka Kinen]], where Gold Ship was the guaranteed favorite to win. Then Gold Ship decided to randomly* rear up when the race started (holding that pose for some time), turning some twelve billion yen worth of bets into smoke. [tn](*Angered by a horse in an adjacent stall, according to some accounts.)[/tn] The [[Umamusume]] [[Gold Ship (umamusume)|]] is sometimes drawn in scenes or with lines alluding to the above incident, as a reference to her real-life counterpart. The Anime version of Umamusume also made a reference to the incident in the first OVA episode, complete with Hosoe Junko (commentator) screaming as she did in the broadcast of the real life version. h4. See also * [[Gold Ship (racehorse)]] * [[Gold Ship (Umamusume)]] h4. External links * "Youtube: 2015 Takarazuka Kinen":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Lv0Mbd1ZPCk] * "Youtube: Comparison of the 12 billion yen incident as depicted in the Umamusume Anime and in real-life":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=011A2xkdL4k]

title: gangsta_hold
body:
[[Holding gun|Holding a gun]] sideways. So named for the gangsters who supposedly demonstrate this technique in gunfights. Frequently combined with [[dual wielding]].

Shooting a gun in this way has no practical benefit under most circumstances and makes proper aiming very difficult. However, the style has become somewhat popular in rap culture and among street criminals (who do not often use the gun sight) due to its portrayal in U.S. film and television since the 1990s, which in turn was inspired by Hong Kong action cinema beginning in the '70s and '80s. It is believed that Hong Kong actors needed to hold their guns in this way because some Chinese-made automatics couldn't eject shell casings reliably.

It is also known that this type of grip was sometimes used during the Chinese Civil War of the '30s and '40s with full-auto versions of the top-ejecting [[Mauser C96|Mauser C96 "Broomhandle"]] pistol, which had an extremely high rate of fire and significant muzzle climb when fired normally. When held in what's now known as gangsta style and fired, the muzzle would instead "climb" sideways and thus sweep across everything in front of the shooter. A similar technique was sometimes used with submachine guns during World War II, but as they were significantly bulkier and heavier than the C96 it was considerably more awkward.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Side grip":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Side_grip

title: kagamine_len_(if)
body:
One alternate design by [[kei_(keigarou)|KEI]] proposed for [[Kagamine Len]]. This version gained popularity after the success of [[Hatsune_Miku_(if)|Hatsune Miku's 'if' design]], which prompted the release and promotion of other beta designs.

The overall design is quite similar to the current one, but the major differences are an [[alternate color]] scheme (wich includes [[yellow eyes]] and  [[yellow shorts]]), an [[alternate hairstyle]] which consist of [[straight_hair|straight]] [[short hair]] with [[swept bangs]] hold  by [[hairclip|hairclips]]. This, along with the more [[androgynous]] appearance, makes him look more similar to his [[Kagamine Rin (if)|counterpart]].


Original art: post #182359

title: soredemo_ayumu_wa_yosetekuru
body:
A [[comic]] by [[Yamamoto Souichirou]] about two members of a [[Shogi]] club who have crushes on one another.

The series originally began as a web comic posted on the author's Twitter account under the title [i]Shougi no Yatsu[/i]. The series later began serialization in Weekly Shounen Magazine under the title [i]Soredemo Ayumu wa Yosetekuru[/i] during March 2019. There is a 2022 anime adaption produced by [i]Silver Link[/i]. It is licensed in NA by Kodansha USA under the title: When Will Ayumu Make His Move?

h4. Characters
* [[Tanaka Ayumu]]
* [[Yaotome Urushi]]

title: charlotte_corday_(fate)
body:
Assassin-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. A figure from the French Revolution who assassinated Jean-Paul Marat and was subsequently executed by [[guillotine]] for her crime.

Before her reveal, fans gave her the nickname [b][i]Tawawa Assassin[/i][/b] (たわわのアサシン), due to her striking resemblance (both her face and her [[large_breasts|breast size]]) to [[ai-chan_(tawawa)|Ai-chan]] from the [[Getsuyoubi no Tawawa]] series.

title: hijikata_toshizou_(fate)
body:
Berserker-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Debuted in the GudaGuda Meiji Isshin event. Wears a western-style outfit or a worn kimono and tattered grey Shinsengumi haori. Wields a katana, rifle and revolver in battle, and his Noble Phantasm is "Shinsengumi: Undying Sincerity", a powerful attack that only grows stronger the closer he is to death.

Like the other Shinsengumi servants, Hijikata is often depicted with certain personality from character based on the same figure in [i][[Gintama]][/i]. Specifically [[Hijikata Toushirou]]'s [[mayonnaise]] addiction.

[b]Character Design[/b]: [[Yogo Yuuki]] 
[b]Voice Actor[/b]: Hoshino Takanori

h4.Costumes

* [[hijikata toshizou (dream portrait) (fate)|Heroic Spirit Dream Portrait]]
* Oni's Tea Ceremony

title: nanaca_crash
body:
A fan-made [[Flash game]] which features characters from an eroge called [[Cross Channel]]. In the game, the player launches a boy (Kurosu Taichi) through the air by first hitting him with a bicycle.

The object of the game is to launch your character as far as possible. Your score is determined by the distance of his flight. Certain characters he crashes into will greatly affect his velocity.

title: cigarette_case
body:
A cigarette case, also known as a cigarette tin, is a sturdy container designed hold cigarettes and protect them from being crushed.  Commonly depicted as a small metal clamshell case with the inside of each side deep enough to hold a single row of [[cigarette]]s.

Not to be confused with a [[cigarette pack|cigarette pack]], the disposable packaging cigarettes are sold in.
